ALLOW_DB_CREATION.description: Whether to allow the creation of new databases. Useful for ensuring existing production environments don't inadvertently create new databases.

CLIENT_SUBDOMAINS.description: Comma-separated list of client subdomains, e.g. 'www,app,auth,'. Include an empty string (such as in the example) to indicate there's a client for the root domain.

DEPLOYMENT_NAME.description: The name of the deployment, e.g. 'production', 'staging', 'development'. This may be used in strings such as database file names and logging metadata; each deployment should have a unique name.

DOMAIN.description: The root domain of the deployment, e.g. 'saf.com'.

DOMAIN_REDIRECTS.description: Comma-separated list of domains to redirect to the root domain, e.g. 'old-subdomain1.saf.com,old-subdomain2.saf.com'.

MOCK_INTEGRATIONS.description: Whether to mock 3rd party integrations. Set to 'true' to mock. And integration packages should respect this setting.

NODE_ENV.description: The environment of the deployment. Generally should avoid using this, consider its use deprecated, prefer instead more specific environment variables.

PROTOCOL.description: The protocol of the deployment, e.g. 'https'

SERVICE_SUBDOMAINS.description: Comma-separated list of service subdomains, e.g. 'revenue,geo,identity,core'.

TRADEMARK.description: The trademark of the product provided at the domain, e.g. 'Hooli Chat'.

TZ.description: The timezone of the deployment, e.g. 'America/New_York'. Must be UTC.
